name: The Intervals
description: This story will be about intervals. So, in this kata your task is to write a program which, given a list of intervals and a list of numbers, determines for each number the appropriate intervals it belongs to and returns a string using the expected formatting (see below). ### Inputs * Intervals are given as a list of tuples. Both boundaries of an interval are exclusive: `(3,11)` means any value `x` so that `3 < x < 11`. * the second argument is a list of values (integers) ### Output * For one value in the list of numbers, identify all the inervals it belongs to and build a single string with the following notations: - `2` belong to the interval `(1,4)`, so the output would be: `"2 ∈ (1;4)"`. Note the semi colon in the string representation of the interval. - With the intervals: `(1,3)`, `(3,5)` and `(2,9)`, `4` belongs to the two last only, so the output would be: `"4 ∈ (3;5) ∩ (2;9)"` - The intervals are handled in the order of the list of intervals argument. * When several numbers are given: - Strings are concatenated together, separated by `and`: ``` intervals: [(2,5), (3,8)] numbers: [4, 6] output: "4 ∈ (2;5) ∩ (3;8) and 6 ∈ (3;8)" ``` - Numbers are handled in the order of the argument. * Numbers that don't belong to any intervals are omitted from the output Enjoy /ᐠ｡.｡ᐟ\\
